titleStmt.title: The historie of the Councel of Trent Conteining eight bookes. In which (besides the ordinarie actes of the Councell) are declared many notable occurrences, which happened in Christendome, during the space of fourtie yeeres and more. And, particularly, the practises of the Court of Rome, to hinder the reformation of their errors, and to maintaine their greatnesse. Written in Italian by Pietro Soaue Polano, and faithfully translated into English by Nathanael Brent.
Historia del Concilio tridentino. English
titleStmt.author: Sarpi, Paolo, 1552-1623.
Brent, Nathaniel, Sir, 1573?-1652.

editionStmt.edition: Vnto this second edition are added diuers obseruable passages, and epistles, concerning the trueth of this historie, specified in the next page.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Bonham Norton and Iohn Bill, printers to the Kings most excellent Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Historia del Concilio tridentino.
The words "second edition" on the title page are printed in large caps. Variant: "second edition" printed in large and small caps.
Running title reads: The history of the Councell of Trent.
Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library.
